nodes.text: In 13 ABY the New Republic vessel Endor was ambushed by the Restored Empire, an Imperial faction of hardliners under the leadership of the Warlord Devian that refused the Imperial Remnant authority, while patrolling the space around the planetoid RZ7-6113-23.

Following the dissolution of the interim Imperial Ruling Council, the New Republic amped up its efforts to patrol the farthest corners of the galaxy in an attempt to quell and potential uprisings or pockets of Imperial resistance. Many of these operations were commanded by General Han Solo, who operated in the manner of "aggressive negotiations".

Concurrently, the Imperial Warlord Devian became wary of the remainder of the Empire, known as the Imperial Remnant, under the influence of Admiral Gilad Pellaeon. Amidst the possibility of an Imperial ceasefire with the New Republic, Devian and his followers seceded from the Remnant, feeling it strayed from the late Emperor Palpatine's original vision. Devian and his followers took control of a storehouse on the Class-6 planetoid RZ7-6113-23. The storehouse was secretly commissioned in the early days of Palpatine's rule, and was stocked with Clone Wars-era starships that officially ended production. Devian planned to build a military strong enough to topple both the New Republic and the Imperial Remnant. The so called "hardliners" of the Imperial Remnant dubbed themselves the "Restored Empire".

While patrolling the sector containing RZ7-6113-23, the crew of the Endor intercepted two TIE/sr starfighters. Because of their short-ranged nature, the scouts' presence in the area led the captain of the cruiser to suspect an Imperial base in the area, and as such he ordered the crew to follow the TIEs from a distance. The two scouts diverted from their path and began heading to the planetoid's surface, confirming the captain's suspicions. However, as the crew of the cruiser detected a large energy spike originating from a cannon in the vicinity of the ground base, the captain realized they were led into a trap, and ordered an immediate retreat. However, he was too late to realize the error of his judgment, and the cruiser was destroyed by a single blast from the fully charged cannon.

In the wake of the ambush, word of Devian's plot reached Vima-Da-Boda, a Jedi of Luke Skywalker's New Jedi Order. She promptly warned Skywalker of the massive plot brewing against the New Republic, and warned him to beware of a man named Devian.
Shortly after the ambush, the Restored Empire hired the renowned bounty hunter Boba Fett to transport the former Imperial guardsmen Kir Kanos from the backwater planet Meenka to their base on RZ7.
The ambush on the Dauntless cruiser was depicted in the opening scene of the first issue of Star Wars: Crimson Empire III—Empire Lost, the third and final installment of the Crimson Empire trilogy.
